trans-unit.source: Azure uses an xml file to define all VNets available to a subscription.
trans-unit.target: Azure uses an xml file to define all VNets available to a subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can download this file, and edit it to modify or delete existing VNets, and create new ones.
trans-unit.target: You can download this file, and edit it to modify or delete existing VNets, and create new ones.

trans-unit.source: In this document, you will learn how to download this file, referred to as network configuration (or netcgf) file, and edit it to create a new VNet.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you will learn how to download this file, referred to as network configuration (or netcgf) file, and edit it to create a new VNet.

trans-unit.source: Check the <linkText>Azure virtual network configuration schema</linkText><title></title> to learn more about the network configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Check the <linkText>Azure virtual network configuration schema</linkText><title></title> to learn more about the network configuration file.

trans-unit.source: To create a VNet using a netcfg file through the Azure portal, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To create a VNet using a netcfg file through the Azure portal, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: From a browser, navigate to http://manage.windowsazure.com and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: From a browser, navigate to http://manage.windowsazure.com and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down on the list of services, and click on NETWORKS as seen below.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down on the list of services, and click on NETWORKS as seen below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure virtual networks</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure virtual networks</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the bottom of the page, click the EXPORT button, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: On the bottom of the page, click the EXPORT button, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Export button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Export button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Export network configuration page, select the subscription you want to export the virtual network configuration from, and then click the check mark button on the bottom left hand corner of the page.
trans-unit.target: On the Export network configuration page, select the subscription you want to export the virtual network configuration from, and then click the check mark button on the bottom left hand corner of the page.

trans-unit.source: Follow your browser instructions to save the NetworkConfig.xml file.
trans-unit.target: Follow your browser instructions to save the NetworkConfig.xml file.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you note where you are saving the file.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you note where you are saving the file.

trans-unit.source: Open the file you saved in step 5 above using any XML or text editor application, and look for the element. If you have any networks already created, each network will be displayed as its own element.
trans-unit.target: Open the file you saved in step 5 above using any XML or text editor application, and look for the element. If you have any networks already created, each network will be displayed as its own element.

trans-unit.source: To create the virtual network described in this scenario, add the following XML just under the element:
trans-unit.target: To create the virtual network described in this scenario, add the following XML just under the element:

trans-unit.source: Save the network configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Save the network configuration file.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the bottom left hand corner of the page, click NEW, then click NETWORK SERVICES, then click VIRTUAL NETWORK, and then click IMPORT CONFIGURATION as shown in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the bottom left hand corner of the page, click NEW, then click NETWORK SERVICES, then click VIRTUAL NETWORK, and then click IMPORT CONFIGURATION as shown in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Import configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Import configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Import the network configuration file page, click BROWSE FOR FILE..., then navigate to the folder you saved your file in step 8 above, select the file, and then click Open.
trans-unit.target: On the Import the network configuration file page, click BROWSE FOR FILE..., then navigate to the folder you saved your file in step 8 above, select the file, and then click Open.

trans-unit.source: The web page should look similar to the figure below.
trans-unit.target: The web page should look similar to the figure below.

trans-unit.source: On the bottom right hand corner of the page, click on the arrow button to move to the next step.
trans-unit.target: On the bottom right hand corner of the page, click on the arrow button to move to the next step.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Import network configuration file page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Import network configuration file page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Building your network page, notice the entry for your new VNet, as shown in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: On the Building your network page, notice the entry for your new VNet, as shown in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Building your network page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Building your network page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click on the check mark button on the bottom right hand corner of the page to create the VNet.
trans-unit.target: Click on the check mark button on the bottom right hand corner of the page to create the VNet.

trans-unit.source: After a few seconds your VNet will be shown in the list of available VNets, as shown in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: After a few seconds your VNet will be shown in the list of available VNets, as shown in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New virtual network</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New virtual network</linkText>
